# 1. Load cleaned datasets

## Load dry weights data  

```{r, load_dry_weights}
load("/processed_data/[spcode]_dry_weights.RData")
```

```{r}
glimpse([spcode]_dry_weights)
```

## Load Droughtbox data

```{r, load_droughtbox_data}
[spcode]_droughtbox_data <- read_hie_droughtbox_data_folder("./[spcode]/[spcode]_droughtbox_data")
```

```{r}
names([spcode]_droughtbox_data)
```

# 2. Clean Droughtbox data

Remember to remove the `eval=FALSE` from each chunk

## File 1: 25c

```{r, eval = FALSE, echo = FALSE, include = FALSE}
#[sp_name]_25c_cleaned <- 
    
    # Select the data to be clean
    [sp_name]_raw_data["file_name_25c.dat"] %>% 
    
    # Transform list element to dataframe type
    as.data.frame(.) %>%

    # clean colnames
    `colnames<-`(str_extract(colnames(.), '\\b\\w+$')) %>%

   # Choose a interval of time
    filter_droughtbox_data(.,
                           from_start_time = "HH:MM:SS",
                           to_end_time = "HH:MM:SS") %>% 
    # Clean the data
    clean_droughtbox_data(.,
                          remove_n_observations = 5,
                          threshold = 0.2) %>% 
  
    # Step done to avoid breaking the time sequence
    arrange(date_time)
```

### Plot cleaned data

```{r, plot_cleaned_data_25c, eval = FALSE, include = FALSE}
plot_strains_weights([sp_name]_25c_cleaned, show_tare_group = FALSE)
```

## Merge cleaned dataframes

```{r, eval=FALSE}
[sp_name]_merged_cleaned_data <- 
                    merge_droughtbox_data(#[sp_name]_25c_cleaned,
                                          [sp_name]_30c_cleaned,
                                          [sp_name]_35c_cleaned,
                                          [sp_name]_40c_cleaned,
                                          [sp_name]_45c_cleaned,
                                          [sp_name]_50c_cleaned,
                                          [sp_name]_55c_cleaned)
```

### Plot Merged data

```{r,plot_merged_data, fig.width=20, fig.height=12, eval=FALSE}
plot_strains_weights([sp_name]_merged_cleaned_data,
                     show_smooth_lines = FALSE,
                     show_tare_group = FALSE)
```

## Reshape merged data

```{r reshape_data, eval=FALSE}
[sp_name]_reshaped_data <- 

    reshape_droughtbox_data([sp_name]_merged_cleaned_data) %>% 
    arrange(string_number, date_time)

```     

## Join reshaped data with dry weights

```{r, eval=FALSE}
[sp_name]_reshaped_data <- 
         
    inner_join([sp_name]_reshaped_data, 
               [sp_name]_dry_weights_25c, 
               by = join_by(string_number)) 
```

### Plot data with dry weights

```{r, echo=FALSE}
string_colors <- c(string_1 = "#eec000",
                   string_2 = "#cf544c",
                   string_3 = "#0175c3",
                   string_4 = "#878687",
                   
                   string_5 =  "#000000",
                   string_6 =  "#008b28",
                   string_7 =  "#8600b6",
                   string_8 =  "#00a0ab")
```


```{r, plot_raw_data_dry_weights, fig.width=16, fig.height=8, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(data = [sp_name]_reshaped_data, aes(x = date_time,
                                           y = string_weight_grams, 
                                           colour = string_number)) +
    geom_point() + 

    # Increase the number of y-axis tick marks
    scale_y_continuous(breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 10)) + 

    theme_bw() +

    # Put legend at the bottom
    theme(legend.position = "bottom") +

    facet_wrap(~string_number, ncol = 4) +

    geom_hline(data = [sp_name]_reshaped_data, aes(yintercept=sample_dry_weight_grams)) +

    # Set colors  
    scale_color_manual(values = string_colors) 
```

# 3. Calculate the relative water content

```{r,eval=FALSE}
[sp_name]_rwc_data <- 
  
    [sp_name]_reshaped_data %>%
  
      select(-c(tc_avg_deg_c_avg, spcode, paper_bag_group, file)) %>%
      rowwise() %>%
      group_by(string_number,temperature_measured) %>%
      
      mutate(relative_water_content_perc = 
               (string_weight_grams - sample_dry_weight_grams) / (max(string_weight_grams)-sample_dry_weight_grams))      

```

## Plot RWC

```{r, plot_rwc, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(data = [sp_name]_rwc_data,
      aes(x = date_time, y = relative_water_content_perc, colour = string_number)) +
    
    geom_point() + 

    # Increase the number of y-axis tick marks
    scale_y_continuous(breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 10)) + 

    theme_bw() +

    # Put legend at the bottom
    theme(legend.position = "bottom") +

    facet_wrap(~string_number, ncol = 4) +

    # Set colors  
    scale_color_manual(values = string_colors)
```
